result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda D Baures was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur.
11/22/16  Probation is extended for 1 yr from 2/10/17 to 2/10/18, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Joint & Several with co-defs.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$200 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:35
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Nicole K. Vander Meulen.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Bail Monitoring Program out-of-state travel request; Defendant allowed to travel to Minnesota for work
Status conference on June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at the residence of the victims identified in the Criminal Complaint.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Thomas W. or Christopher C.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
